definition: to be in a bad mood

pinyin: min2 zu2 zhu3 yi4 qing2 xu4

sentences.english: I hope that these 17 tips will help you find a way out of grumpiness.
sentences.chinese: 我希望这17个办法可以帮助你脱离暴躁的情绪。

sentences.english: Vegetable elder sister Yue now body weak, the emotion ought no undulate too many.
sentences.chinese: 素月姐现在身子虚弱，情绪不宜太过波动。

sentences.english: A depressive disorder is not the same as a passing blue mood.
sentences.chinese: 抑郁障碍跟一晃而过的忧郁情绪还不一样。

sentences.english: Relaxing foods can enhance your mood and state of mind.
sentences.chinese: 放松食品可以改善你的情绪和精神状态。

sentences.english: The image of youth comes from the artist's self-reflection and expression of emotion.
sentences.chinese: 少年的形象是出于作者对自我情绪的反思和表达。

sentences.english: Increased positive feelings and reduced feelings of anxiety, anger and sadness.
sentences.chinese: 增加正面的工作情绪，减少紧张，愤怒及懮伤。

sentences.english: Anti-immigration sentiments are stronger in an economic crisis.
sentences.chinese: 在经济危机中，反移民的情绪会增长。

sentences.english: Like before, government officials will speak to boost market sentiment.
sentences.chinese: 像以前一样，政府官员会出面安慰市场情绪。

sentences.english: It used to be that much of this discontent boiled under the surface.
sentences.chinese: 在过去，许多不满情绪在社会表层下沸腾。

sentences.english: You will always recognize concealed emotions.
sentences.chinese: 你将永远能够辨识掩藏的情绪。

sentences.english: Broaden and build leads to positive emotions.
The emotional body is nothing else than the child within you.
sentences.chinese: 情绪身体无外乎就是你内心的小孩。

sentences.english: The promoters figured "peace" would link the anti-war sentiment to the rock concert.
sentences.chinese: 促进者们表示，“和平”将反战情绪带进摇滚音乐会。

sentences.english: However, new trapped emotions could possibly form a new wall.
sentences.chinese: 可是，新的压抑情绪可能会筑造一道新墙。

sentences.english: She is always in that gloomy mood.
Nobody carries a grudge better than this sign.
sentences.chinese: 没有哪个星座比蝎子更容易产生怨恨情绪了。

definition: to drain (by leading off water)/to unburden oneself/to divulge/to leak a secret
attitude (of the heart)/state of one's psyche/way of thinking/mentality
to mediate/to reconcile/to make peace/to intervene
